title: Socrat
description: His teaching divided ancient Greek philosophy into ' pre-Socratic ' and 'Socratic' periods. Unlike his predecessors, who were interested in the creation of the cosmos and everything that exists, Socrates began to study the inner world of man.

title: Aristophanes
description: Aristophanes staged his first comedy in 427 BC. e., but under a different name. When a year later he ridiculed the powerful demagogue Cleon in his Babylonians , calling him a tanner , the latter accused him before the council of having condemned and ridiculed the politics of Athens in the presence of representatives from the allied states

title: Euripides
description: The ancient 'Biographies' of Euripides claim that he was born on Salamis , on the day of the famous victory of the Greeks over the Persians in a naval battle, September 23, 480 BC. e. , from Mnesarchus and Kleito.
